abstract.p: Letter from Frank J Fahrenkopf Jr (American Gaming Assn) opposes legislation to ban all gambling on college sports

block.p: Re ''The Casino Corrupts the Arena,'' by James C. Dobson (Op-Ed, May 5), about legislation to ban all gambling on college sports: Congress should look at the facts before it rushes to punish a legal, highly regulated business, its customers and employees, while absolving the National Collegiate Athletic Association for a problem that flourishes on its campuses.
Legal sports wagering represents about 1 percent of all sports betting. The proposed ban does nothing to address the 99 percent of sports betting that is illegal.

Re ''The Casino Corrupts the Arena,'' by James C. Dobson (Op-Ed, May 5), about legislation to ban all gambling on college sports: Congress should look at the facts before it rushes to punish a legal, highly regulated business, its customers and employees, while absolving the National Collegiate Athletic Association for a problem that flourishes on its campuses.
Legal sports wagering represents about 1 percent of all sports betting. The proposed ban does nothing to address the 99 percent of sports betting that is illegal.
Of the thousands of games played in the 1990's, there were only a handful of point-shaving scandals, all of which centered on illegal betting.
FRANK J. FAHRENKOPF JR. President and Chief Executive American Gaming Association Washington, May 15, 2000
